alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 3:22AM CDT until March 24 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Barry County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 322 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cassville, Pineville, Noel, Purdy, Seligman, Wheaton, Shell Knob, Butterfield, Mcdowell, Powell, Jenkins, Roaring River State Park and Big Sugar Creek State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway C, Bentonville Hollow at Highway E, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Mikes Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway U and Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
